result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark A. Boogren was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency and abide by any treatment recommendations.

records.addlTxt:
D.A. John Snider appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Nielsen.
Plea quest. & waiver of rights form filed. The parties stipulate that this is a 7th offense.  (.216)
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1 of the information. Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and defendant found guilty as to Count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.
Count 3 is dismissed.
The Court sentences the defendant to 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System.
ITOC - 3 years
EXS - 5 years
Atty. Nielsen will calculate credit and notify the clerk.
Sentence is concurrent with sentence imposed in 14 CF 278.
Conditions of extended supervision:  1)  Pay a fine of $3839.50, plus any other costs and fees applicable, 2) Undergo AODA and any other counseling or assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and complete any treatment recommendations. 3) Driver's license revocation for a period of 36 months, and IID installation for a period of 36 months.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse and Early Release programs.
Appeal rights, WEDS form, voter and firearms restrictions were provided.
